file_content.text: Our business is concluded--but I'm sure you will hear my name again in the context of some brilliant finding.
Welcome back, my illustrious colleague. Tell me you've taken the seismic readings?
I managed the job.
I didn't break a sweat.
Fantastic. I tell you, we are going to make history together.
Don't know why I bothered.
How can you say that? We're going to make history with these results!
Quickly. Please, let me examine the Burba Seismic Activity Reader....
Incredible. My genius is truly incredible. My theory is accurate. The planet is in danger! This reading proves it.
You were right. I suppose you'll be getting your grant.
Congratulations.
Yes. Yes, I suppose I will.
I don't think we should evacuate the planet just yet.
Let's not be hasty.
Far more research will have to be done to convince the Senate, but this will get the ball rolling.
I'm not sure you should be so pleased.
That's a callous attitude.
Scientific discovery is always thrilling, my friend. I assure you, I am not celebrating the implications of this finding.
Worry not. You have done a great deed today. Take your reward and celebrate!
What? It can't be. This indicates there is no unusual seismic activity at all!
It seems your theory proved to be incorrect.
I'm sorry, but it's true.
This means the planet won't be destroyed, right?
That's good news.
Yes... I mean, of course. I'm just surprised. It's atypical for one of my theories to be wrong.
There's nothing wrong with the reading I took.
I didn't mess up.
I just can't believe it. I haven't been wrong in so long....
This could reflect very poorly on my reputation. I suggest you take your compensation and keep quiet--I believe the reward is generous, given the outcome.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have much to consider. Farewell.
What are you waiting for? I need the seismic readings as soon as possible.
Jedi! Thank you for coming over. I am Fez Burba, scientist-notary of the Republic and planetary consult to the Galactic Senate.
Finally, military assistance! I am Fez Burba, scientist-notary of the Republic and planetary consult to the Galactic Senate.
Greetings, humble citizen. I am Fez Burba, scientist-notary of the Republic and planetary consult to the Galactic Senate.
My current project could alter history. If my theory proves correct, I will be the most famous scientist who ever lived.
Consider this--we all know the Imperial bombardment of Coruscant wreaked havoc on the infrastructure. But what if it also damaged the planet's very core?
Would there be a way to repair the damage?
What could be done?
Perhaps, depending on the extent of it... but most likely, the planet would have to be evacuated.
Go on.
Damage to the core could cause geothermal instability, plate fragmentation--in short, level the whole city.
That's the stupidest thing I've ever heard.
You're crazy.
I assure you, it's not impossible. The bombardment of Lexus Nine created a rift beneath the surface that caused unprecedented cataclysms. Everyone died.
It is crucial that I get seismic readings from the lower levels. Specifically, from the Works sector.
In the spirit of scientific inquiry and on behalf of the safety of the Republic, I need you to perform this critical mission.
Prove my theory correct, and the Senate will grant me a substantial endowment for further research. I will give you a generous reward as compensation.
If your theory's incorrect--what happens then?
What if you're wrong?
I will still pay, of course, but your compensation will be significantly less.
All that's required is that you take the Burba Seismic Activity Reader--my invention, of course--and use it in the Works.
The reader is both accurate and user-friendly. The challenge will be in the journey, not in the science.
I'm on it.
I should warn you--in the unlikely case that my theory is wrong, I'll have to pay significantly less. Budgetary constraints, you know.
Get lost, you pompous freak.
No way. [Refuse quest]
Well. You certainly don't have to be rude.
Please, not right now! I'm working.
